description: tighten +‎ -er. Referring to a meal, suggests the tightening of one's belt around the expanding waistline.

entries.meaning: (UK, slang, archaic) A large meal; a feast or blowout.
examples: One proposed going to Hungerford-market to do a feed on decayed shrimps or other offal laying about the market; another proposed going to Covent-garden to do a 'tightener' of rotten oranges, to which I was humorously invited;  […]
